channel.title: BigQuery on Just Numbers & Things
channel.description: Recent content in BigQuery on Just Numbers & Things

item.title: Exploring Complex Types in BigQuery
item.description: Introduction Google’s BigQuery has support for complex types (arrays & structs) which are relatively new in analytical databases. While the ideas and of arrays and structs aren’t unique to BigQuery some of the syntax and capabilities are unique. In this post I’ll be going over what I’ve found to be the most useful patterns and tricks. Arrays Put plainly an array is a series of values of the same type stored within a single value.

item.title: Connecting to Google BigQuery with DBeaver
item.description: 0) Install DBeaver You can find installation instructions here 1) Download the latest drivers You can find the latest drivers on Google’s website 2) Create a folder to store the drivers mkdir ~/.dbeaver-drivers/bigquery/ 3) Extract driver jars and move to the folder we made earlier 4) Create a New Driver in DBeaver Navigate to Database > Driver Manager > New Add all the files from ~/.dbeaver-drivers/bigquery/ Driver name: BigQuery (for labeling only) Class name: com.
